murphymurphyjohn@... wrote:

> Considering the question posed about sword metals,  to my knowledge,  all or 
> most of the extant samurai  blades are of steel,  or possibly the most early 
> Japanese swords of iron.  

Generally, that's spot on. Some of the earliest blades unearthed were of iron, 
although many bronze spear-heads and similar items of bronze were found in 
Japanese tumuli. There were a few bronze swords as well, but they don't seem to 
be in the majority in the early period.


Tony
